alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Greenwood; Laurens (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:17AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elbert, west central Laurens, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 217 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Anderson to 8 miles southeast of Elberton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Iva, Lake Secession, Donalds, Hodges and Lowndesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
